title: Understand the Regression Equation
text: We have a regression line represented as $$y=ax+b$$. The 'a' is the slope and it tells us the rate of change of sit-ups for each increase in TV hours. The 'b' is the y-intercept, which tells us the number of sit-ups when TV hours are $$0$$.

title: Breaking Down the Formula
text: Before plugging in the values, take a moment to remind yourself that in $$y=ax+b$$, both 'a' and 'b' are constants given in the problem. So when we say $$y=ax+b$$, we're substituting known values to estimate $$y$$.

title: Find the Slope's Influence
text: The given slope is $$-1.341$$. This means for every additional hour of TV watched, the number of sit-ups decreases by $$1.341$$. How many hours of TV are we considering in our problem?

title: Plug in TV Hours
text: You need to substitute the given number of TV hours (11) into the equation. What happens to the sit-up count when $$x$$ is 11? Let's find out!

title: Calculate to Find $$y$$
text: Using the regression formula, $$y=-1.341\times11+32.234$$, calculate to determine the number of sit-ups possible.
